marketNews.title: Sektor Properti: Kompilasi Marketing Sales 9M25
marketNews.content: Several residential property developers announced their 9M25 marketing sales results, including Ciputra Development ($CTRA), Summarecon Agung ($SMRA), Alam Sutera Realty ($ASRI), and Pakuwon Jati ($PWON). SMRA recorded the highest marketing-sales growth in 9M25 (+34% YoY), achieving 71% of the 2025 marketing-sales target, better than 9M24 (61% in 2024). The surge is attributed to the launch of a new product in Summarecon Serpong in 2Q25. CTRA achieved the highest target realization at 76%; in October 2025 CTRA revised the 2025 target down to IDR 10 trillion from IDR 11 trillion (2024 actual 11 trillion). ASRI and PWON realized 60% and 50% of the 2025 target respectively, down from 73% in 9M24 for both. The 9M25 marketing-sales occurred amid a 100% value-added tax (PPN DTP) incentive. The incentive, originally set to end in June 2025 and to be reduced to 50% for July-December 2025, was extended to remain at 100% for July-December 2025, and in October 2025 the Finance Minister announced the 100% incentive would be extended to 2027. During 9M25, PWON contributed the highest share of PPN DTP-eligible sales (73.3% of total marketing-sales). SMRA has not released its PPN DTP contribution data. A chart (Weekly_2025-10-21_19-01-48.png) shows ASRI and PWON share prices on the left y-axis, SMRA, BSDE and CTRA on the outer right y-axis, and the BI Rate (IDBIRRPO Index) on the inner right y-axis, with a 40-week lag applied to the rate to reflect expectation effects. Key takeaway: marketing-sales outlook depends more on consumer purchasing power than further rate cuts, as mortgage rates are already low and sticky (average bank mortgage rate fell from 6.91% in Dec-2024 to 6.84% in Jun-2025, while the BI Rate has fallen 125 bps YTD). Historical chart suggests lower rates could still boost property-sector share prices.

marketNews.title: TLKM Spin-off Sebagian Bisnis Wholesale Fiber Connectivity
marketNews.content: Telkom Indonesia signed an agreement with its subsidiary PT Telkom Infrastruktur Indonesia (TIF) to spin off a portion of its wholesale fiber-connectivity business and assets to TIF. The transaction, valued at approximately IDR 35.8 trillion, will help the company sharpen its business focus and optimise the use of its optical-fiber network, according to TLKM.

marketNews.title: IPCC Reports 3Q25 Net Profit of IDR 76 Billion
marketNews.content: Indonesia Kendaraan Terminal reported a net profit of IDR 76 billion in 3Q25 (+14% YoY, +22% QoQ). The result lifted 9M25 net profit to IDR 190 billion (+29% YoY). The profit increase was driven by higher revenue and higher interest income; revenue rose +9%/+13% YoY in 3Q25/9M25, while financial income surged +36%/+42% YoY.

marketNews.title: WIFI Reports 1.5 Million Home Pass and 830 K Home Connect in 9M25
marketNews.content: WIFI’s Director of Digital Solutions, Shannedy Ong said WIFI has built 1.5 million home-pass and 830,000 home-connect by the end of 9M25, a take-up rate of 55%. Compared with December 2024, home-pass grew 11.3-fold and home-connect 8.2-fold. WIFI targets 2.5 million home-pass and 1.5 million home-connect by end-2025.

marketNews.title: PT PP and ADHI Merger Planned for 2H26
marketNews.content: PT PP and Adhi Karya (ADHI) will merge in 2H26, with the merged entity to be named PTPP. COO Danantara Dony Oskaria gave no comment, while Company Secretary Joko Raharjo said the merger is targeted for 2026.

marketNews.title: APEX Secures US$13.6 Million Offshore Drilling Contract
marketNews.content: Apexindo Pratama Duta secured a sea-drilling contract from PT Pertamina Hulu Mahakam for a seven-month period, valued at US$13.6 million (≈IDR 225 billion).

marketNews.title: Madhani Talatah Nusantara Sells 105 Million DEWA Shares
marketNews.content: Shareholder PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara sold 105 million DEWA shares on 13 Oct 2025 at an average price of IDR 75 per share, total value about IDR 7.9 billion. After the transaction, Madhani’s direct ownership fell from 6.07% to 5.81%.

marketNews.title: RISE Plans Rights Issue of Up to 1.3 Billion New Shares
marketNews.content: Jaya Sukses Makmur Sentosa plans a rights issue of up to 1.3 billion new shares, with pricing and ratio yet to be announced. Proceeds will be used for strategic land development, working capital and/or repayment of bank loans. The proposal will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders’ meeting on 27 Nov 2025.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Announces Plan for Domestic National Car Production
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto said Indonesia will produce a domestically made national car within three years, with the government allocating funds and land for the plant. The statement was made on 20 Oct 2025.

marketNews.title: Minister Bahlil Says Bio-Ethanol (E10) Mandate May Start by 2027
marketNews.content: Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia said the government is still studying the start-date for a mandatory 10% bio-ethanol blend (E10) in gasoline, likely no later than 2027. The policy aims to ensure domestic ethanol plants can meet the blend demand, with feedstock sourced from cassava and sugarcane, creating new jobs for farmers.

marketNews.title: Safeguard Duties on Imported Cotton Yarn Effective 30 Oct 2025
marketNews.content: The government will impose safeguard duties on imported cotton yarn for three years starting 30 Oct 2025 under Minister of Finance Regulation No. 67/2025. The duty starts at IDR 7,500 per kg in year 1 and tapers to IDR 7,277 per kg in year 3, aiming to protect the domestic textile industry from import spikes.

marketNews.title: TRIN Discusses Strategic Partner Talks
marketNews.content: Triniti Property (TRIN) disclosed that its management is in intensive talks with a potential strategic partner to strengthen its business structure and capital base, though details were not disclosed.

marketNews.title: MMIX Announces 1:1 Bonus Share Issue
marketNews.content: Multi Medika Internasional (MMIX) plans a 1:1 bonus share issue from a share premium of IDR 60 billion. The cum-date is the regular market, with trading on 23 Oct 2025 and the bonus distribution on 10 Nov 2025.

marketNews.title: TIRT Receives Shipping Licence and Vessel Lease Agreements
marketNews.content: Tirta Mahakam Resources (TIRT) obtained a shipping-company business licence (SIUPAL) from the Ministry of Transportation and signed a vessel lease: IDR 250 million per month to PT Guna Harapan Lestari and IDR 5.25 billion per month to PT Lima Srikandi Jaya. The company operates freight-charter and time-charter contracts and is applying for a mining-service licence to transport minerals under freight-charter.

marketNews.title: Gold ATH Explained by VarelJoanK
marketNews.content: “With the wording, the gold price breaking a record is not due to trading momentum but reflects a structural global shift,” said VarelJoanK.

tickerNews.title: CTRA Revises 2025 Marketing-Sales Target Down to IDR 10 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Ciputra Development reported a 2025 marketing-sales target revision down to IDR 10 trillion (from IDR 11 trillion) and a 76% realization of the 2025 target as of October 2025.

tickerNews.title: SMRA Posts 71% Realization of 2025 Marketing-Sales Target
tickerNews.content: Summarecon Agung recorded the highest 9M25 marketing-sales growth (+34% YoY) and reached 71% of the 2025 target, up from 61% in 9M24, driven by the launch of a new product in Summarecon Serpong in 2Q25.

tickerNews.title: ASRI 9M25 Marketing-Sales at 60% of Target
tickerNews.content: Alam Sutera Realty achieved 60% of its 2025 marketing-sales target in 9M25, lower than the 73% achieved in 9M24.

tickerNews.title: PWON 9M25 Marketing-Sales at 50% of Target
tickerNews.content: Pakuwon Jati achieved 50% of its 2025 marketing-sales target in 9M25, down from 73% in 9M24.

tickerNews.title: PWON Leads PPN DTP Contribution to Marketing-Sales
tickerNews.content: During 9M25, PWON contributed 73.3% of total marketing-sales that qualified for the 100% PPN DTP incentive, the highest share among issuers.

tickerNews.title: Chart Note on Stock-Price and BI Rate Axes
tickerNews.content: TLKM stock price is shown on the left-hand y-axis; SMRA, BSDE and CTRA are on the outer right-hand y-axis; the BI Rate (IDBIRRPO Index) is on the inner right-hand y-axis with a 40-week lag to reflect expectation effects.
